{"step_by_step_thinking": "Breast cancer prognosis is not directly inherited. While certain genetic mutations, such as BRCA1 and BRCA2, can be inherited and increase the risk of developing breast cancer, the prognosis of the disease depends on many factors including the stage of the disease, the type of cancer, the patient's overall health, and the treatment received. Therefore, while genetic factors can influence the risk of developing breast cancer, they do not determine the prognosis of the disease.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
